byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin reported from Washington, and Alexander Burns from New York. Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Grand Rapids, Mich., and Thomas Kaplan from Kent, Ohio.
byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS

abstract: Hillary Clinton's campaign maintains that it is confident it will weather uproar sparked by Federal Bureau of Investigation director James Comey's announcement that agency is reviewing newly discovered emails related to Hillary Clinton's personal server; acknowledges its momentum has been slowed and that hopes for increasing support in places like Iowa and Ohio have been dimmed.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton’s campaign was optimistic that she would weather the F.B.I.’s review of a top aide’s emails, but acknowledged that optimism of gaining ground in places like Ohio and Iowa was fading.
snippet: Mrs. Clinton’s campaign was optimistic that she would weather the F.B.I.’s review of a top aide’s emails, but acknowledged that optimism of gaining ground in places like Ohio and Iowa was fading....

headline.main: Confidence Even as Hillary Clinton’s Momentum Slows
headline.print_headline: Confidence Even as Clinton’s Momentum Slows
